metadata.jobDescription:
Technical Product Manager - Developer Infrastructure

Leading roadmap development for SDKs, APIs, and developer infrastructure that
powers the Gensyn network for ML developers working with decentralized training
infrastructure. Translating intricate distributed systems and ML workflows into
accessible developer products.

Must-have: Strong product delivery in developer tools/infrastructure, distributed
systems or ML platform experience, SDK/API architecture expertise, crypto protocol
familiarity. Background building developer platforms at premier ML, cloud, or Web3
organizations preferred.

hero.status: Open to Technical PM roles — ML Infrastructure, Web3 Protocols, Developer Platforms
hero.subheadline: Senior Technical PM with 8 years at the convergence of blockchain infrastructure and developer platforms. From institutional staking APIs to gaming wallet SDKs—I translate complex distributed systems into accessible developer experiences. Now exploring where ML training meets decentralized compute.

about.tagline: Eight years building developer infrastructure where cutting-edge technology meets production readiness—from enterprise blockchain at Microsoft to decentralized ML frameworks. Passionate about making complex systems accessible.
bio: Currently at Anchorage Digital, I lead protocol integrations and staking infrastructure serving institutional clients. I've shipped 7+ L2 integrations (Optimism, Base, Arbitrum) and built ETF-grade validator APIs—designing distributed systems that balance performance, security, and developer experience. Before that, I built MPC-based Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs at Forte for gaming studios, and Flow CLI/Cadence developer tools at Dapper Labs that reduced onboarding time by 60%.

I started at Microsoft shipping Xbox royalties on Ethereum—one of the first production smart contracts in enterprise, requiring Docker/K8s orchestration for blockchain nodes. I'm deeply experienced in distributed systems, crypto protocols, and developer tooling. Gensyn's mission to democratize ML compute through decentralized infrastructure resonates with my background: I've lived at this intersection of blockchain, developer experience, and cutting-edge technology for years. Currently exploring AI agent orchestration as a passion project.

highlights: Built distributed validator infrastructure for ETF-grade staking—high availability systems
Shipped 7+ L2 protocol integrations with consistent API patterns across chains
Designed infrastructure for institutional-scale distributed systems
Built MPC-based Wallet-as-a-Service SDK for gaming studios
Designed distributed key management infrastructure for non-custodial wallets
Shipped SDK enabling AAA gaming partners to integrate crypto seamlessly
Shipped Flow CLI and developer tools for blockchain developers
Reduced developer onboarding time by 60% through improved tooling
Built infrastructure enabling 10K+ developers to deploy on Flow
First production smart contract at Microsoft—Xbox royalties on Ethereum
Built Docker/K8s orchestration for distributed blockchain nodes
Pioneered enterprise blockchain infrastructure before 'Web3' existed

caseStudies.reasoning: AI agent framework - directly relevant to ML infrastructure and demonstrates passion for AI/ML
Flow CLI and dev tools - SDK architecture and developer experience expertise
L2 protocol integrations - distributed systems and blockchain protocol experience
Distributed validator infrastructure - relevant to decentralized compute networks
API infrastructure scaling - platform thinking for distributed systems
Early blockchain infrastructure - shows pioneering spirit in emerging tech

projects.reasoning: AI/ML framework development - directly aligned with Gensyn's ML focus
Developer tools for blockchain - relevant SDK/tooling experience
Crypto-native analytics - demonstrates Web3 domain expertise
